com.camerontec.catalys.server

Class CatalysApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.server.component.ComponentHelper
        • com.camerontec.catalys.server.CatalysApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IComponent, IHasAttributes, IConfigurable, IRegisterable, ICatalysEventListener, EventListener

    public class CatalysApplication
extends ComponentHelper
implements ICatalysEventListener
    Main wrapper class for the currently executing application.

    Fires the following events:

    • ConfigurationCleared
    • ConfigurationLoaded
    • ClusterPrimaryStatusEvent
    • NewConnectionPointEvent
    • NewSessionEvent
    • NewSessionManager

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void activateComponents(Set<IComponent> components)
      Selectively performs the activation of the given set of non-active components based on what the current application run-level is: If the current run-level is ApplicationRunLevel.STOPPED, none of the provided components gets activated. If the current run-level is ApplicationRunLevel.STAND_BY, only those of the provided components that fulfill all conditions below get activated: Components must be instances of IService. Components must have their IComponent.SERVICE_ALWAYS_ACTIVE attribute set to Boolean.TRUE. If the current run-level is ApplicationRunLevel.STARTED, components are processed as follows: Components are first sorted according to their data type: Applications: instances of CatalysApplication. Services: instances of IService. Session Managers: instances ISessionManager. Monitors: instances of either of: ISessionStatusEventListener, ISessionManagerListener, ISessionCustomizer Server connection managers: instances of ServerConnectionManager. Schedulers: instances of IScheduler. SessionOverseers: instances of SessionOverseer. Other components: components that do not fall into any of the above categories. Components are then activated in turn in the following order: Catalys Applications Schedulers SessionOverseers Services Monitors Session Managers Server connection managers Components that fall into none of the above categories (referred to as Other components) are *not* activated.
      void addLink(ILink link)

      void deactivateComponents(Set<IComponent> components)
      Selectively performs the deactivation of the given set of active components: Components are first sorted according to their data type: Applications: instances of CatalysApplication. Services: instances of IService. Session Managers: instances ISessionManager. Monitors: instances of either of: ISessionStatusEventListener, ISessionManagerListener, ISessionCustomizer Server connection managers: instances of ServerConnectionManager. Schedulers: instances of IScheduler. SessionOverseers: instances of SessionOverseer. Other components: components that do not fall into any of the above categories. Components are then deactivated in turn in the following order: Server connection managers Session Managers Monitors Services SessionOverseers Schedulers Catalys Applications Components that fall into none of the above categories (referred to as Other components) are *not* deactivated.

      • toRunLevel

        public void toRunLevel(ApplicationRunLevel toRunLevel)
                throws Exception
        Takes the application to the desired run-level. Depending on the current run-level, it performs the following actions:

        To
        STOPPED STAND_BY STARTING STARTED STOPPING
        From STOPPED
        X
        • Activates the HA context
        • Starts permanent services
        X
        • Activates the scheduler
        • Starts all services
        • Starts monitors
        • Starts session managers
        • Starts server connection managers
        X
        STAND_BY
        • Stops permanent services
        • Deactivates the HA context
        X
        -
        X
        X
        STARTING
        • Stops permanent services
        • Deactivates the HA context
        -
        X
        • Activates the scheduler
        • Starts non-permanent services
        • Starts monitors
        • Starts session managers
        • Starts server connection managers
        X
        STARTED
        • Changes the run-level to STOPPING
        • Invokes toRunLevel(STOPPED)
        • Changes the run-level to STOPPING
        • Invokes toRunLevel(STAND_BY)
        X
        X
        -
        STOPPING
        • Stops server connection managers
        • Stops session managers
        • Stops monitors
        • Stops all services
        • Deactivates the scheduler
        • Stops server connection managers
        • Stops session managers
        • Stops monitors
        • Stops non-permanent services
        • Deactivates the scheduler
        X
        X
        X
        Parameters:
        toRunLevel - the desired run-level
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the application is not in HA mode and toRunLevel is ApplicationRunLevel.STAND_BY
        Exception - if an exception occurs when activating or deactivating a component in the application

      • activateComponents

        public void activateComponents(Set<IComponent> components)
                        throws Exception
        Selectively performs the activation of the given set of non-active components based on what the current application run-level is:
        • If the current run-level is ApplicationRunLevel.STOPPED, none of the provided components gets activated.
        • If the current run-level is ApplicationRunLevel.STAND_BY, only those of the provided components that fulfill all conditions below get activated:
          • Components must be instances of IService.
          • Components must have their IComponent.SERVICE_ALWAYS_ACTIVE attribute set to Boolean.TRUE.
        • If the current run-level is ApplicationRunLevel.STARTED, components are processed as follows:
          • Components are first sorted according to their data type:
            • Applications: instances of CatalysApplication.
            • Services: instances of IService.
            • Session Managers: instances ISessionManager.
            • Monitors: instances of either of: ISessionStatusEventListener, ISessionManagerListener, ISessionCustomizer
            • Server connection managers: instances of ServerConnectionManager.
            • Schedulers: instances of IScheduler.
            • SessionOverseers: instances of SessionOverseer.
            • Other components: components that do not fall into any of the above categories.
          • Components are then activated in turn in the following order:
            1. Catalys Applications
            2. Schedulers
            3. SessionOverseers
            4. Services
            5. Monitors
            6. Session Managers
            7. Server connection managers
          • Components that fall into none of the above categories (referred to as Other components) are *not* activated. These components are assumed to be under the control of some other component (also referred to as their parent component) which is responsible for the activation of its dependent components. And every component in the application either falls into one of the above four categories, or has an ancestor component that falls into one of the above four categories.
        Parameters:
        components - the set of components to activate or deactivate
        Throws:
        Exception - if an exception is thrown by a particular component's IComponent.setComponentActive(boolean)
        NullPointerException - if components is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if components contains a component that is already active

      • deactivateComponents

        public void deactivateComponents(Set<IComponent> components)
                          throws Exception
        Selectively performs the deactivation of the given set of active components:
        • Components are first sorted according to their data type:
          • Applications: instances of CatalysApplication.
          • Services: instances of IService.
          • Session Managers: instances ISessionManager.
          • Monitors: instances of either of: ISessionStatusEventListener, ISessionManagerListener, ISessionCustomizer
          • Server connection managers: instances of ServerConnectionManager.
          • Schedulers: instances of IScheduler.
          • SessionOverseers: instances of SessionOverseer.
          • Other components: components that do not fall into any of the above categories.
        • Components are then deactivated in turn in the following order:
          1. Server connection managers
          2. Session Managers
          3. Monitors
          4. Services
          5. SessionOverseers
          6. Schedulers
          7. Catalys Applications
        • Components that fall into none of the above categories (referred to as Other components) are *not* deactivated. These components are assumed to be under the control of some other component (also referred to as their parent component) which is responsible for the activation and deactivation of its dependent components. And every component in the application either falls into one of the above four categories, or has an ancestor component that falls into one of the above four categories.
        Parameters:
        components - the set of components to activate or deactivate
        Throws:
        Exception - if an exception is thrown by a particular component's IComponent.setComponentActive(boolean)
        NullPointerException - if components is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if components contains a component that is already inactive
